intro: Cyanea coriacea var. fauriei, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, glossy leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Cyanea coriacea var. fauriei is often found growing in shaded, rocky habitats along the shoreline.
